org.flixel.FlxG

type
class
This is a global helper class full of useful functions for audio, input, basic info, and the camera system among other things. Utilities for maths and color and things can be found in FlxU. FlxG is specifically for Flixel-specific properties.

Static Variables

public BLACK(inline,null) : UInt

And black too.

public BLUE(inline,null) : UInt

Blue is used to indicate non-solid objects.

public DEBUGGER_BIG(inline,null) : Int

Debugger overlay layout preset: Large windows taking up bottom half of screen.

public DEBUGGER_LEFT(inline,null) : Int

Debugger overlay layout preset: Large windows taking up left third of screen.

public DEBUGGER_MICRO(inline,null) : Int

Debugger overlay layout preset: Tiny windows in the screen corners.

public DEBUGGER_RIGHT(inline,null) : Int

Debugger overlay layout preset: Large windows taking up right third of screen.

public DEBUGGER_STANDARD(inline,null) : Int

Debugger overlay layout preset: Wide but low windows at the bottom of the screen.

public DEBUGGER_TOP(inline,null) : Int

Debugger overlay layout preset: Wide but low windows at the top of the screen.

public GREEN(inline,null) : UInt

Green is used to indicate solid but immovable objects.

public LIBRARY_MAJOR_VERSION(inline,null) : Int

Assign a major version to your library. Appears before the decimal in the console.

public LIBRARY_MINOR_VERSION(inline,null) : Int

Assign a minor version to your library. Appears after the decimal in the console.

public LIBRARY_NAME(inline,null) : String

If you build and maintain your own version of flixel, you can give it your own name here.

public PINK(inline,null) : UInt

Pink is used to indicate objects that are only partially solid, like one-way platforms.

public RED(inline,null) : UInt

Some handy color presets. Less glaring than pure RGB full values. Primarily used in the visual debugger mode for bounding box displays. Red is used to indicate an active, movable, solid object.

public WHITE(inline,null) : UInt

White... for white stuff.

public _cache : Hash<nme.display.BitmapData>

Internal storage system to prevent graphics from being used repeatedly in memory.

private _cameraRect : nme.geom.Rectangle

Internal helper variable for clearing the cameras each frame.

public _game : FlxGame

Internal tracker for game object.

private _volume : Float

Internal volume level, used for global sound control.

public bgColor(getBgColor,setBgColor) : UInt

public camera : FlxCamera

By default this just refers to the first entry in the cameras array declared above, but you can do what you like with it.

public cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

An array of FlxCamera objects that are used to draw stuff. By default flixel creates one camera the size of the screen.

public debug : Bool

Whether you are running in Debug or Release mode. Set automatically by FlxPreloader during startup.

public elapsed : Float

Represents the amount of time in seconds that passed since last frame.

public globalSeed : Float

The global random number generator seed (for deterministic behavior in recordings and saves).

The height of the screen in game pixels.

public keys : org.flixel.system.input.Keyboard

A reference to a FlxKeyboard object. Important for input!

public level : Int

public levels : Array<Dynamic>

FlxG.levels and FlxG.scores are generic global variables that can be used for various cross-state stuff.

public maxTouchPoints : Int

The maximum number of concurrent touch points supported by the current device.

public mobile : Bool

Setting this to true will disable/skip stuff that isn't necessary for mobile platforms like Android. BETA

public mouse : org.flixel.system.input.Mouse

A reference to a FlxMouse object. Important for input!

public music : FlxSound

A handy container for a background music object.

public mute : Bool

Whether or not the game sounds are muted.

public paused : Bool

Handy shared variable for implementing your own pause behavior.

public plugins : Array<FlxBasic>

An array container for plugins. By default flixel uses a couple of plugins: DebugPathDisplay, and TimerManager.

public save : Int

public saves : Array<Dynamic>

FlxG.saves is a generic bucket for storing FlxSaves so you can access them whenever you want.

public score : Int

public scores : Array<Dynamic>

public sounds : FlxGroup

A list of all the sounds being played in the game.

public stage(getStage,null) : nme.display.Stage

public state(getState,null) : FlxState

public supportsTouchEvents : Bool

Indicates whether the current environment supports basic touch input, such as a single finger tap.

public timeScale : Float

How fast or slow time should pass in the game; default is 1.0.

public touchManager : org.flixel.system.input.TouchManager

A reference to a TouchManager object. Useful for devices with multitouch support

public tweener : FlxBasic

Global tweener for tweening between multiple worlds

public useBufferLocking : Bool

Allows you to possibly slightly optimize the rendering process IF you are not doing any pre-processing in your game state's draw() call.

public visualDebug : Bool

Whether to show visual debug displays or not. Default = false.

public volume(getVolume,setVolume) : Float

public volumeHandler : Float -> Void

Set this hook to get a callback whenever the volume changes. Function should take the form myVolumeHandler(Volume:Number).

public width : Int

The width of the screen in game pixels.

public worldBounds : FlxRect

The dimensions of the game world, used by the quad tree for collisions and overlap checks.

public worldDivisions : Int

How many times the quad tree should divide the world on each axis. Generally, sparse collisions can have fewer divisons, while denser collision activity usually profits from more. Default value is 6.

Static Methods

public addBitmap(Graphic : Dynamic, ?Reverse : Bool, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String, ?FrameWidth : Int, ?FrameHeight : Int) : nme.display.BitmapData

Loads a bitmap from a file, caches it, and generates a horizontally flipped version if necessary.
Parameters:
Graphic - The image file that you want to load.
Reverse - Whether to generate a flipped version.
Unique - Ensures that the bitmap data uses a new slot in the cache.
Key - Force the cache to use a specific Key to index the bitmap.
Returns:
The BitmapData we just created.

public addCamera(NewCamera : FlxCamera) : FlxCamera

Add a new camera object to the game. Handy for PiP, split-screen, etc.
Parameters:
NewCamera - The camera you want to add.
Returns:
This FlxCamera instance.

public addPlugin(Plugin : FlxBasic) : FlxBasic

Adds a new plugin to the global plugin array.
Parameters:
Plugin - Any object that extends FlxBasic. Useful for managers and other things. See org.flixel.plugin for some examples!
Returns:
The same FlxBasic-based plugin you passed in.

public checkBitmapCache(Key : String) : Bool

Check the local bitmap cache to see if a bitmap with this key has been loaded already.
Parameters:
Key - The string key identifying the bitmap.
Returns:
Whether or not this file can be found in the cache.

public clearBitmapCache() : Void

Dumps the cache's image references.

public collide(?ObjectOrGroup1 : FlxBasic, ?ObjectOrGroup2 : FlxBasic, ?NotifyCallback : FlxObject -> FlxObject -> Void) : Bool

Call this function to see if one FlxObject collides with another. Can be called with one object and one group, or two groups, or two objects, whatever floats your boat! For maximum performance try bundling a lot of objects together using a FlxGroup (or even bundling groups together!).

This function just calls FlxG.overlap and presets the ProcessCallback parameter to FlxObject.separate. To create your own collision logic, write your own ProcessCallback and use FlxG.overlap to set it up.

NOTE: does NOT take objects' scrollfactor into account, all overlaps are checked in world space.

Parameters:
ObjectOrGroup1 - The first object or group you want to check.
ObjectOrGroup2 - The second object or group you want to check. If it is the same as the first, flixel knows to just do a comparison within that group.
NotifyCallback - A function with two FlxObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:FlxObject,Object2:FlxObject) - that is called if those two objects overlap.
Returns:
Whether any objects were successfully collided/separated.

public createBitmap(Width : UInt, Height : UInt, Color : UInt, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String) : nme.display.BitmapData

Generates a new BitmapData object (a colored square) and caches it.
Parameters:
Width - How wide the square should be.
Height - How high the square should be.
Color - What color the square should be (0xAARRGGBB)
Unique - Ensures that the bitmap data uses a new slot in the cache.
Key - Force the cache to use a specific Key to index the bitmap.
Returns:
The BitmapData we just created.

public destroySounds(?ForceDestroy : Bool) : Void

Called by FlxGame on state changes to stop and destroy sounds.
Parameters:
ForceDestroy - Kill sounds even if they're flagged survive.

public drawPlugins() : Void

Used by the game object to call draw() on all the plugins.

public fade(?Color : UInt, ?Duration : Float, ?FadeIn : Bool, ?OnComplete : Void -> Void, ?Force : Bool) : Void

The screen is gradually filled with this color.
Parameters:
Color - The color you want to use.
Duration - How long it takes for the fade to finish.
FadeIn - True fades from a color, false fades to it.
OnComplete - A function you want to run when the fade finishes.
Force - Force the effect to reset.

public flash(?Color : UInt, ?Duration : Float, ?OnComplete : Void -> Void, ?Force : Bool) : Void

All screens are filled with this color and gradually return to normal.
Parameters:
Color - The color you want to use.
Duration - How long it takes for the flash to fade.
OnComplete - A function you want to run when the flash finishes.
Force - Force the effect to reset.

public getBgColor() : UInt

Get and set the background color of the game. Get functionality is equivalent to FlxG.camera.bgColor. Set functionality sets the background color of all the current cameras.

public getFlashFramerate() : Int

How many times you want your game to update each second. More updates usually means better collisions and smoother motion. NOTE: This is NOT the same thing as the Flash Player framerate!

public getFramerate() : Int

How many times you want your game to update each second. More updates usually means better collisions and smoother motion. NOTE: This is NOT the same thing as the Flash Player framerate!

public getLibraryName() : String

public getPlugin(ClassType : Class<FlxBasic>) : FlxBasic

Retrieves a plugin based on its class name from the global plugin array.
Parameters:
ClassType - The class name of the plugin you want to retrieve. See the FlxPath or FlxTimer constructors for example usage.
Returns:
The plugin object, or null if no matching plugin was found.

public getRandom(Objects : Array<Dynamic>, ?StartIndex : Int, ?Length : Int) : Dynamic

Fetch a random entry from the given array. Will return null if random selection is missing, or array has no entries. FlxG.getRandom() is deterministic and safe for use with replays/recordings. HOWEVER, FlxU.getRandom() is NOT deterministic and unsafe for use with replays/recordings.
Parameters:
Objects - A Flash array of objects.
StartIndex - Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.
Length - Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
Returns:
The random object that was selected.

public getStage() : nme.display.Stage

Read-only: retrieves the Flash stage object (required for event listeners) Will be null if it's not safe/useful yet.

public getState() : FlxState

Read-only: access the current game state from anywhere.

public getVolume() : Float

Set volume to a number between 0 and 1 to change the global volume.

public init(Game : FlxGame, Width : Int, Height : Int, Zoom : Float) : Void

Called by FlxGame to set up FlxG during FlxGame's constructor.

public loadReplay(Data : String, ?State : FlxState, ?CancelKeys : Array<String>, ?Timeout : Float, ?Callback : Void -> Void) : Void

Load replay data from a string and play it back.
Parameters:
Data - The replay that you want to load.
State - Optional parameter: if you recorded a state-specific demo or cutscene, pass a new instance of that state here.
CancelKeys - Optional parameter: an array of string names of keys (see FlxKeyboard) that can be pressed to cancel the playback, e.g. ["ESCAPE","ENTER"]. Also accepts 2 custom key names: "ANY" and "MOUSE" (fairly self-explanatory I hope!).
Timeout - Optional parameter: set a time limit for the replay. CancelKeys will override this if pressed.
Callback - Optional parameter: if set, called when the replay finishes. Running to the end, CancelKeys, and Timeout will all trigger Callback(), but only once, and CancelKeys and Timeout will NOT call FlxG.stopReplay() if Callback is set!

public loadSound(?EmbeddedSound : Dynamic, ?Volume : Float, ?Looped : Bool, ?AutoDestroy : Bool, ?AutoPlay : Bool, ?URL : String) : FlxSound

Creates a new sound object.
Parameters:
EmbeddedSound - The embedded sound resource you want to play. To stream, use the optional URL parameter instead.
Volume - How loud to play it (0 to 1).
Looped - Whether to loop this sound.
AutoDestroy - Whether to destroy this sound when it finishes playing. Leave this value set to "false" if you want to re-use this FlxSound instance.
AutoPlay - Whether to play the sound.
URL - Load a sound from an external web resource instead. Only used if EmbeddedSound = null.
Returns:
A FlxSound object.

public lockCameras() : Void

Called by the game object to lock all the camera buffers and clear them for the next draw pass.

public log(Data : Dynamic) : Void

Log data to the debugger.
Parameters:
Data - Anything you want to log to the console.

public overlap(?ObjectOrGroup1 : FlxBasic, ?ObjectOrGroup2 : FlxBasic, ?NotifyCallback : FlxObject -> FlxObject -> Void, ?ProcessCallback : FlxObject -> FlxObject -> Bool) : Bool

Call this function to see if one FlxObject overlaps another. Can be called with one object and one group, or two groups, or two objects, whatever floats your boat! For maximum performance try bundling a lot of objects together using a FlxGroup (or even bundling groups together!).

NOTE: does NOT take objects' scrollfactor into account, all overlaps are checked in world space.

Parameters:
ObjectOrGroup1 - The first object or group you want to check.
ObjectOrGroup2 - The second object or group you want to check. If it is the same as the first, flixel knows to just do a comparison within that group.
NotifyCallback - A function with two FlxObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:FlxObject,Object2:FlxObject) - that is called if those two objects overlap.
ProcessCallback - A function with two FlxObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:FlxObject,Object2:FlxObject) - that is called if those two objects overlap. If a ProcessCallback is provided, then NotifyCallback will only be called if ProcessCallback returns true for those objects!
Returns:
Whether any oevrlaps were detected.

public pauseSounds() : Void

Pause all sounds currently playing.

public play(EmbeddedSound : Dynamic, ?Volume : Float, ?Looped : Bool, ?AutoDestroy : Bool) : FlxSound

Creates a new sound object from an embedded Class object. NOTE: Just calls FlxG.loadSound() with AutoPlay == true.
Parameters:
EmbeddedSound - The sound you want to play.
Volume - How loud to play it (0 to 1).
Looped - Whether to loop this sound.
AutoDestroy - Whether to destroy this sound when it finishes playing. Leave this value set to "false" if you want to re-use this FlxSound instance.
Returns:
A FlxSound object.

public playMusic(Music : Dynamic, ?Volume : Float) : Void

Set up and play a looping background soundtrack.
Parameters:
Music - The sound file you want to loop in the background.
Volume - How loud the sound should be, from 0 to 1.

public random() : Float

Generates a random number. Deterministic, meaning safe to use if you want to record replays in random environments.
Returns:
A Number between 0 and 1.

public recordReplay(?StandardMode : Bool) : Void

Resets the game or state and requests a new recording.
Parameters:
StandardMode - If true, reset the entire game, else just reset the current state.

public reloadReplay(?StandardMode : Bool) : Void

Resets the game or state and replay requested flag.
Parameters:
StandardMode - If true, reload entire game, else just reload current game state.

public removeBitmap(Graphic : String) : Void

public removeCamera(Camera : FlxCamera, ?Destroy : Bool) : Void

Remove a camera from the game.
Parameters:
Camera - The camera you want to remove.
Destroy - Whether to call destroy() on the camera, default value is true.

public removePlugin(Plugin : FlxBasic) : FlxBasic

Removes an instance of a plugin from the global plugin array.
Parameters:
Plugin - The plugin instance you want to remove.
Returns:
The same FlxBasic-based plugin you passed in.

public removePluginType(ClassType : Class<FlxBasic>) : Bool

Removes an instance of a plugin from the global plugin array.
Parameters:
ClassType - The class name of the plugin type you want removed from the array.
Returns:
Whether or not at least one instance of this plugin type was removed.

public reset() : Void

Called whenever the game is reset, doesn't have to do quite as much work as the basic initialization stuff.

public resetCameras(?NewCamera : FlxCamera) : Void

Dumps all the current cameras and resets to just one camera. Handy for doing split-screen especially.
Parameters:
NewCamera - Optional; specify a specific camera object to be the new main camera.

public resetDebuggerLayout() : Void

Just resets the debugger windows to whatever the last selected layout was (DEBUGGER_STANDARD by default).

public resetGame() : Void

Like hitting the reset button a game console, this will re-launch the game as if it just started.

public resetInput() : Void

Reset the input helper objects (useful when changing screens or states)

public resetState() : Void

Request a reset of the current game state.

public resumeSounds() : Void

Resume playing existing sounds.

public setBgColor(Color : UInt) : UInt

public setDebuggerLayout(Layout : Int) : Void

Change the way the debugger's windows are laid out.
Parameters:
Layout - See the presets above (e.g. DEBUGGER_MICRO, etc).

public setFlashFramerate(Framerate : Int) : Int

public setFramerate(Framerate : Int) : Int

public setVolume(Volume : Float) : Float

public shake(?Intensity : Float, ?Duration : Float, ?OnComplete : Void -> Void, ?Force : Bool, ?Direction : Int) : Void

A simple screen-shake effect.
Parameters:
Intensity - Percentage of screen size representing the maximum distance that the screen can move while shaking.
Duration - The length in seconds that the shaking effect should last.
OnComplete - A function you want to run when the shake effect finishes.
Force - Force the effect to reset (default = true, unlike flash() and fade()!).
Direction - Whether to shake on both axes, just up and down, or just side to side (use class constants SHAKE_BOTH_AXES, SHAKE_VERTICAL_ONLY, or SHAKE_HORIZONTAL_ONLY). Default value is SHAKE_BOTH_AXES (0).

public shuffle(Objects : Array<Dynamic>, HowManyTimes : Int) : Array<Dynamic>

Shuffles the entries in an array into a new random order. FlxG.shuffle() is deterministic and safe for use with replays/recordings. HOWEVER, FlxU.shuffle() is NOT deterministic and unsafe for use with replays/recordings.
Parameters:
A - A Flash Array object containing...stuff.
HowManyTimes - How many swaps to perform during the shuffle operation. Good rule of thumb is 2-4 times as many objects are in the list.
Returns:
The same Flash Array object that you passed in in the first place.

public stopRecording() : String

Stop recording the current replay and return the replay data.
Returns:
The replay data in simple ASCII format (see FlxReplay.save()).

public stopReplay() : Void

Stops the current replay.

public stream(URL : String, ?Volume : Float, ?Looped : Bool, ?AutoDestroy : Bool) : FlxSound

Creates a new sound object from a URL. NOTE: Just calls FlxG.loadSound() with AutoPlay == true.
Parameters:
URL - The URL of the sound you want to play.
Volume - How loud to play it (0 to 1).
Looped - Whether or not to loop this sound.
AutoDestroy - Whether to destroy this sound when it finishes playing. Leave this value set to "false" if you want to re-use this FlxSound instance.
Returns:
A FlxSound object.

public switchState(State : FlxState) : Void

Switch from the current game state to the one specified here.

public tween(object : Dynamic, values : Dynamic, duration : Float, ?options : Dynamic) : org.flixel.tweens.misc.MultiVarTween

Tweens numeric public properties of an Object. Shorthand for creating a MultiVarTween tween, starting it and adding it to a Tweener.
Parameters:
object - The object containing the properties to tween.
values - An object containing key/value pairs of properties and target values.
duration - Duration of the tween.
options - An object containing key/value pairs of the following optional parameters: type Tween type. complete Optional completion callback function. ease Optional easer function. tweener The Tweener to add this Tween to.
Returns:
The added MultiVarTween object. Example: FlxG.tween(object, { x: 500, y: 350 }, 2.0, { ease: easeFunction, complete: onComplete } );

public unlockCameras() : Void

Called by the game object to draw the special FX and unlock all the camera buffers.

public unwatch(AnyObject : Dynamic, ?VariableName : String) : Void

Remove a variable from the watch list in the debugger. Don't pass a Variable Name to remove all watched variables for the specified object.
Parameters:
AnyObject - A reference to any object in your game, e.g. Player or Robot or this.
VariableName - The name of the variable you want to watch, in quotes, as a string: e.g. "speed" or "health".

public updateCameras() : Void

Called by the game object to update the cameras and their tracking/special effects logic.

public updateInput() : Void

Called by the game object to update the keyboard and mouse input tracking objects.

public updatePlugins() : Void

Used by the game object to call update() on all the plugins.

public updateSounds() : Void

Called by the game loop to make sure the sounds get updated each frame.

public watch(AnyObject : Dynamic, VariableName : String, ?DisplayName : String) : Void

Add a variable to the watch list in the debugger. This lets you see the value of the variable all the time.
Parameters:
AnyObject - A reference to any object in your game, e.g. Player or Robot or this.
VariableName - The name of the variable you want to watch, in quotes, as a string: e.g. "speed" or "health".
DisplayName - Optional, display your own string instead of the class name + variable name: e.g. "enemy count".

Constructor

public new()
